questions.question:
Claim: "Drinking water helps improve skin health."
Supporting Statement: "Hydrated skin generally looks healthier."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Reading regularly improves vocabulary."
Supporting Statement: "A study found that people who read books frequently have larger vocabularies compared to those who do not read."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Exercising regularly can boost mental health."
Supporting Statement: "Aerobic exercise has been proven to reduce symptoms of anxiety and depression in many patients."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Learning music improves cognitive abilities in children."
Supporting Statement: "Children who play musical instruments score higher on cognitive tests than those who do not."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Spending time in nature can reduce stress levels."
Supporting Statement: "People often feel more relaxed after taking a walk in the park."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "A balanced diet can improve overall energy levels."
Supporting Statement: "Eating a balanced diet makes some people feel better throughout the day."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Bilingual individuals have better multitasking abilities than monolinguals."
Supporting Statement: "A Neuroscience Society shows that bilingual individuals switch between tasks more effectively than those who speak only one language."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Getting adequate sleep improves memory retention."
Supporting Statement: "Some people think that their memory improves after getting adequate sleep."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Reading aloud to children can enhance their language skills."
Supporting Statement: "Some parents have noticed that their children learn new words when read aloud."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Regular physical activity can improve sleep quality."
Supporting Statement: "Individuals who exercise at least 30 minutes daily fall asleep faster and have deeper sleep cycles than those who are less active."
What type of supporting evidence is this?

Statement: "Weaker evidence can sometimes still be used to support a claim, but it may not be as persuasive as stronger or strongest evidence."
True or False?

Statement: "An opinion from an expert in the relevant field, even without specific data, is usually stronger evidence than a general opinion from a layperson."
True or False?

Statement: "A weaker evidence always includes a comparison between two or more studies to reinforce its reliability."
True or False?

Statement: "Weaker evidence often lacks support from credible sources or research, making it less persuasive in academic arguments."
True or False?

Statement: "Evidence based on a well-conducted clinical trial with large sample sizes is considered weaker than anecdotal evidence."
True or False?

Claim: "Eating vegetables daily leads to better digestive health."
Supporting Statement: "Some people say that adding more vegetables to their diet helps them feel less bloated."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Technology can enhance learning in classrooms."
Supporting Statement: "Students who use educational apps and online resources scored higher in assessments than those who did not."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Reading fiction can improve empathy."
Supporting Statement: "Many people believe that reading stories about characters' emotions can help people understand others' feelings better."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Drinking water improves skin health."
Supporting Statement: "Many individuals have reported that drinking more water helps their skin appear clearer and more hydrated."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Music can improve concentration during study."
Supporting Statement: "Students who listen to classical music while studying perform better on memory tests."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.
